description: Real-time control systems are designed to provide immediate responses to inputs, ensuring that operations occur within a strict time frame. These systems are crucial in applications such as robotics, automotive control, and industrial automation, where delays can lead to failures or safety hazards.
you_have_this_if: You need to process inputs and outputs in real-time.
Your application requires immediate feedback and control.
You are working with hardware that demands low-latency responses.
You are developing systems that operate without a traditional operating system.
You need to ensure high reliability and performance in embedded systems.

approaches.best_for: Building real-time control systems without an OS and implementing hardware-level control.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While effective for specific applications, it may require extensive training data and tuning.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to implement a control system that requires learning from past data and operates in real-time.

start_here: Start with Feed-Forward Neural Networks if you are developing a real-time control system that does not rely on an operating system, as it can effectively manage hardware-level control tasks.
